Hi Rob,

I may be misunderstanding the issue so let me just explain what =
I thought you meant:

My understanding was that you tried to download some =
papers and it wouldn't let you do that.  Note that the eplex website is not=
 supposed to block anyone from downloading papers, whether or not they have=
 an account.  All papers should be freely accessible to anyone on the inter=
net.

So there should be no need to obtain an account.  We don't give accou=
nts to anyone except immediate members of the group.  So if the site told y=
ou that you need an account to access a publication on the site, the site m=
ay be broken in some way.  That's why I was wondering which papers you are =
finding that you can't download?

If anyone else is unable to download pape=
rs from the eplex site that would also help us to track down any problems w=
ith the site.

Thanks,

ken

...> wrote:
